revised_title: Fine Structure and Development of Collenchyma Cells in Heracleum Sphondylium
tldr: The study investigates the fine structure and development of collenchyma cells in Heracleum Sphondylium, focusing on the cellulose component of the cell wall. The cells are elongated with pointed ends and have a high pectin content, which distinguishes them from sclerenchyma cells. The wall thickening occurs early in the elongation period and consists of lamellae running completely around the cell. The study reveals that the cellulose chains in the wall are oriented longitudinally, and the cells show a remarkable uniformity in their structure.
